awd_titl_txt: Morphology, Function and Systematics in Upper Carboniferous Ammonoids
awd_abstract_narration: It is possible to analyze fossil shelled cephalopods in terms              of external shell morphology and hydromechanical characteristics,               using microcomputer simulations and principal components analysis.              This approach will be combined with indexing of internal sutural                form, in order to (a) document the morphological history of Upper               Carboniferous ammonoids in terms of whole-shell and hydromechanical             characteristics; (b) determine whether there is a functional basis              to existing phylogenetic-based systematic schemes for Carboniferous             ammonoids; (c) attempt to determine the extent to which sutural                 form influences ammonoid hydrostatics, and to track changes in                  sutural complexity against shell form and hydrostatics through                  time, in an effort to evaluate the functional role of the suture                and (d) relate the evolutionary history and diversity of                        morphological and hydromechanical characteristics of Upper                      Carboniferous ammonoids to existing models of paleoecology and sea-             level curves for this interval.

pgm_ref.pgm_ref_txt: REU SUPP-Res Exp for Ugrd Supp
